Bought it on sale for 5‚Ç¨ and it did not disappoint. After playing this I finally understand why people like this masterpiece so much, the attention to detail, the physics, the mud, all of it is in some ways better than Snowrunner.

I'm not saying that Snowrunner is bad, but considering that Snowrunner is the third game in the series and didn't carry over some of the best features its older brother Mudrunner is kinda wild.

For starters in Mudrunners truck frames can bend and the suspension feels more realistic. Then there are the small details like wires attached to semi-trailers and different models for same addons depending on the trucks land of origin (russian and american vehicles have different models for fuel tanks and etc).
But most importantly then the main thing in both games, the mud, just behaves more realistically in Mudrunner. Like everywhere you go the mud is soft but not unrealistically deep and pieces of mud actually gets stuck to your tires and affects the way your vehicle drives.

All those negative reviews that say "this game is too hard" or "get stuck everywhere" are just BS, now I don't want to be disrespectful but just get better and learn the game, use some commonsense and don't just drive into a ditch with your little scout, you have to plan ahead and drive carefully (just because the road is shorter doesn't mean that it's the better way).
This game is supposed to be slow because OFFROAD IS SLOW.

Gotta keep in mind that the visuals are not the best but good enough and especially amazing when you consider that the entire game with the American Wilds DLC is UNDER 2 GIGS. That is FR nothing, for comparison 20 minutes of recording with your phones main camera takes about the same space.

=TL:DR= OK'ish game with fun sandbox, but quickly gets boring.
1. i give it 6.5-7/10. It has what it takes to be awesome game, but there is not enough to be done with its mechanics, which are physics BASED and NOT simulation. 
2. Ground effect is awesome at first, but quickly gets annoying when 95% of maps are 1m deep mud trenches. unfortunately out planet is not 95% 1m deep, wet mud and trucks are actually much better at dealing with it than within game. its really annoying to be moving 4 km/h for an hour because game is just unreasonably difficult. Artificially annoying.
3. I wouldn't  complain if there was anything to do with those mechanics in game, other than to traverse low-poly terrain, which is suprisingly not ugly, and delivering logs to lumber mill. it gets really boring. 
4. Variety of trucks keeps it fun, but ultimately, they all work the same. For my playtine, i travelled with 10 little cars and 20 big trucks. They do drive differently, but all are equally ineffective in the only one job they have - traverse mud. Each one suffers from the same drawbacks and each one does equally bad. 
5. Why dafuq do you make everything a deep mud,devs? thinking people do not leave raods to be muddy when they use it for work. i know, because i work in consctrucion company. All maps are the same - no infrastructure whatsoever, and buildings but into most obscure and stupid places, which have absolutely no meaning for good operational efficiency. This irks me the most. outpost and its connections are there for a reason, not just 'because its a game, duh'.

negative.review:
Not for me.

This game is just INFURIATING for all the wrong reasons. The gameplay is a slog consisting of stopping and starting and stopping over and over again because you get stuck in a little mud.
My friend got this game for me and I can seriously NOT recommend anyone play this.
It might be fun for those who like realism and realistic simulations of mud and dirt and truck games but as far as it goes this game just doesn't sit well with me.

The controls are clunky, everything feels slow and sometimes you just get stuck and can't even move any more.
But at least you can drive a Ford F-150 so props for that I guess.

Anyways, get BeamNG.Drive if you wanna scratch that realistic car game itch.
Or get ETS/ATS if you don't wanna deal with getting stuck in mud every 4 minutes.

3/10 Not fun.

I get that the driving and physics is good but that's not enough to to warrant a positive review imo. Plenty of games have had that going back 25 years now - I've driven around this game for hours and there is literally nothing to deliver lol. Did the tutorial, did some of the challenges.. Am I just supposed to drive to the same muddy pile of logs that is identical on every map 100 times and deliver lumber at 5mph? I'm good on that. You get stuck in cervices all the time, theres no pedestrians, no other cars, no weather, no animals, nothing to unlock or look forward to, cant work on your truck, crappy user interface, the maps just feel depressing and empty, there's obviously no storyline or anything like Death Stranding has to keep you invested, you cant buy a garage, hire drivers and manage it like in American Truck Simulator.. Who would honestly play this?
